work.title: Angelus

composer.name: Victoria Borisova-Ollas
composer.longDescription: Victoria Borisova-Ollas is a Russian-Swedish composer known for her emotionally expansive, textural orchestral works. Her compositions often reflect spiritual or metaphysical themes, using layered soundscapes and rich instrumentation to evoke states of memory, transformation, and mystery.
composer.shortDescription: Russian-Swedish composer of textural, spiritual, and emotionally layered orchestral music.
representativeWorks: ... and time is running past midnight ...

work.shortDescription: A luminous orchestral meditation on stillness, memory, and the divine.
work.longDescription: Angelus, composed by Victoria Borisova-Ollas in 2008, is a radiant orchestral work inspired by the spiritual ritual of the Angelus bell. Built around shimmering textures and suspended harmonies, the piece unfolds slowly, invoking both cosmic grandeur and deep personal reflection. Its emotional resonance lies in its balance of mystery and meditative clarity.
work.rawContent:
ORCHESTRAL · SPIRITUAL / ATMOSPHERIC

~15 MINUTES

Instrumentation Summary

Large Orchestra including Celesta, Harp, and Expanded Percussion

Mood and Style

Radiant · Meditative · Expansive

insight: Angelus is a luminous orchestral meditation on stillness, memory, and the divine. Inspired by the spiritual ritual of the Angelus bell, it weaves shimmering textures and slow-burning intensity into a sonic prayer — balancing cosmic scale with deep interiority.

work.title: D’un soir triste

composer.name: Lili Boulanger
composer.longDescription: Lili Boulanger was a prodigious French composer whose brief life yielded works of striking emotional depth and harmonic sophistication. A student of Fauré and the first woman to win the Prix de Rome, her music blends Impressionist textures with deep expressive power.
composer.shortDescription: French composer of radiant, expressive works that blend Impressionism with emotional depth.

work.shortDescription: A velvet-hued chamber meditation on grief, sensuality, and emotional twilight.
work.longDescription: Composed in the final year of her life, Lili Boulanger’s D’un soir triste is a lush, introspective work scored for a chamber ensemble of piano, harp, strings, horn, and clarinet. Its emotional tone is layered with ambiguity and longing, drawing from Impressionist harmony to build a sound world of suspended beauty and quiet sorrow.
work.rawContent:
CHAMBER ORCHESTRA / LARGE ENSEMBLE

~10 MINUTES

Instrumentation Summary

Piano, Harp, Strings, Horn, Clarinet (also available in full orchestral version)

Mood and Style

Dusky · Lush · Wistful

insight: Boulanger’s final completed work is a glowing, sorrow-tinged meditation in sound. Its velvet harmonies and emotional depth create a sensuous haze — perfect for programs exploring twilight moods and the quiet ache of beauty.

work.title: Andante Moderato

composer.name: Florence Price
composer.longDescription: Florence Price was the first African-American woman to have a symphony performed by a major American orchestra. Her music blends European Romanticism with elements of African American spirituals and folk traditions, creating a unique and expressive voice in American classical music.
composer.shortDescription: American composer blending Romanticism with African American musical traditions.

work.shortDescription: A flowing, lyrical chamber work bathing the listener in warmth and expressive elegance.
work.longDescription: Florence Price’s Andante Moderato is a deeply expressive chamber work often performed in both its original version for string quartet and piano and an arrangement for string orchestra. Blending Romantic lyricism with spiritual and blues inflections, the piece offers a tender, intimate atmosphere steeped in warmth and melodic grace.
work.rawContent:
CHAMBER · STRINGS & PIANO

~6 MINUTES

Instrumentation Summary

String Quartet & Piano (also available for string orchestra)

Mood and Style

Tender · Lush · Intimate

insight: A flowing, lyrical movement that unfolds like a private confession. Andante Moderato bathes the listener in warm harmonies and expressive lines — ideal for creating a sensuous, soulful atmosphere steeped in elegance.
